metadata.title: CVE-2024-43167 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Undergoing Certification (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the ub_ctx_set_fwd function inUnbound. This issue could allow an attacker who can invoke specificsequences of API calls to cause a segmentation fault. When certain APIfunctions such as ub_ctx_set_fwd and ub_ctx_resolvconf are called in aparticular order, the program attempts to read from a NULL pointer, leadingto a crash. This issue can result in a denial of service by causing theapplication to terminate unexpectedly.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libunbound8 - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.7
python3-unbound - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.7
unbound - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.7
unbound-anchor - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.7
unbound-host - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unbound package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-1ubuntu5.7').
